website_summaries.verdict: Wayne is known for making quality pumps, and this one is no exception – a sound choice for minor to mid-level applications.
pros: A solid little pump that stands out for its unique Multi-Flo technology with various discharge selections – choose the one you want that specifically fits your water removal needs
cons: Works a bit slowly – not ideal for heavy-duty jobs

customer_reviews.title: Waterbug to the rescue!
customer_reviews.text: I was very reluctant to order this. With a name like "Waterbug", it couldn't be a serious machine - and I needed to empty my 1700 gal swim spa so a new feature could be put on it. Boy was I wrong!. Instructions were really not needed, the arrows and labels on the device were good enough. I plopped that baby in the water and it started to work immediately. The pool was drained within 2 hours. This thing works!
customer_reviews.author: ket

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and pumps fast. I am using for a small leak in basement when it rains. I made a pvc containment sealed with caulk so it would allow water to build up to a suitable level to allow pump and water sensor to work. Using with the Hydrocheck HC7000 water sensing pump controller and works awesome. Will draw water down to about 1/8 inch of water or less but with water sensor it only pumps down to about a 1/4 inch but its doesn't matter since I have the leak contained.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Riess

customer_reviews.title: Nice little pump!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I use this in my inground swimming pool to bring down the water level during the winter. I have a mesh cover that let's rain/snow water collect in the pool. I peel back the cover and immerse the pump in the water. After running for about 3 hours, this pump reduced the water level by about 3 inches. Being able to hook a hose to the top is an additional design feature I really like.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M.

customer_reviews.title: Stock Tank Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Big & heavy - the diameter of a dinner plate. Couldn't possibly tip over! Nice cord keeper slots on sides. Screw on covers for side & top water outlet ports. Garden hose screws on to carry drain water away from side or top. Specifies a GFCI outlet because the power hose is also in the water. This is one of those "Why didn't I buy this years ago? " items. I absolutely LOVE it! Drained 40 gallons of stock tank water in 4 minutes! No need to carry buckets of dirty water & dump it outside. We tried one of those manual skinny hose gimmicks they sell at the state fair. It never worked to empty tanks at our place.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Red Land

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Wish i got this before our basement flooded! As far as I can tell this house has not had water in the basement for at least 30years or never. Thus no sump pump. We were standing in 1.75" of water in our basement not able to pull any more water because none of the local stores had the WaterBUG or a pump that could pull lower at high volume. Once the water stopped coming in the ShopVac did the job finally. I tested the WaterBUG, it does pull down to around a 1\16" .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: QUIT WORKING AFTER 30 MINUTES
customer_reviews.text: I gave this one star because I cannot give it ZERO stars, which it definitely rates!! After less than 30 minutes of use, with still over one inch of water on the floor, the pump ceased to work. No fuses were tripped and no impediments were in the water. This is snow melt water that has entered my cellar. There is no debris. I will be returning this product as defective back to Amazon and WILL NOT purchase from Wayne again!!
customer_reviews.author: travis conrad

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This has worked fabulously for getting water out of our yard as the snow melts. It works surprisingly well on both concrete sidewalks and saturated lawns (when there is a standing puddle). Powerful motor and removes almost all the water. Our only complaint (and the only reason we didn't give 5 stars) is that there is no easy way to carry it. They should include a small handle or something near the top of the pump. We move it rather frequently throughout the yard, and it's a pain to carry it, along with the electrical cords and hose, without a handle. Other than that detail, this is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: We borrowed this from a friend during our 100 year flood where our crawlspace was flooded. This little machine is not a pumping giant, however it was the only pump that sucked out almost all of the water. If you are expecting a high capacity fast moving pump, you will be disappointed. If youre looking for a solid quality, average pump, this should exceed your expectations! Its large base is sturdy, lightweight to carry, and easy to clean, and QUIET!!! We were so impressed we went out and bought our own here.
customer_reviews.author: Michele S.

customer_reviews.title: Good pump but power cord is short - not good for a sump pump!
customer_reviews.text: So I got this pump for my pool cover, as it could get the rain water off the top and was cheaper than the similar "pool cover" marketed sump pumps. The major flaw with this pump is the length of the power cord. It is short compared to every other sump pump I have and this is dangerous. Apparently, that is where they cut costs. I married the cord to a similar extension cord and water proofed the connection, creating a longer cord. Not ideal, and probably cost me more than paying a little more for a sump pump with a proper length power cable.
customer_reviews.author: Mixed Desmid

customer_reviews.title: Pump died after four days
customer_reviews.text: This pump was actually much, much slower at draining our 15,000 gallon pool than the cheap one we got for $60 at a local big box home store. It's still running more than 2 days later. Not happy and disappointed that Amazon's 'return window' has closed after only 30 days (even for Prime members?!) I wouldn't buy this again. Just get a cheap little hose pump and be done with it. Update: pump died four days into pumping out our small 16,000 gallon pool, and company will not accept a return or honor any warranty (there doesn't seem to be one).
customer_reviews.author: AnonReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Low Cost, Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a tankless water heater that requires de-liming annually to keep the warranty intact. I bought this pump due it being almost entirely plastic so that I could recirculate white vinegar with some citric acid added to chelate any calcium. The manufacturer wouldn't answer my questions about the MOC of the seals but at this price I considered the pump a throw away if it failed after an hour of recirculation. After doing the de-liming, I partially dismantled the pump to inspect it and other than some slightly corroded screws, it is fine. I WOULD NOT recommend using this pump for anything more acidic than vinegar and certainly NO flammable liquids. But it's a great device for moving water.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dextrose

customer_reviews.title: Totally useless for draining a hot tub.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. First use it shuts off and on like the motor is overheating. Bought it to drain a hot tub which the water was only 90 degrees. After about 3 minutes it shuts off until you pull it out of water. Tried it in the pool which was 70 degrees same problem.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Attach hose (Mine goes up stairs and out the basement and down the yard.) Put it in the water, turn it on, water gone. I have continual dirt and paint chips in my basement so when it starts to sound rough, I pick it up and clean off the little intakes. Doesn't take many uses before you can tell what's going on by sound. Only gets down to 3/8 inch so I finish it off with quick suck of the wet vac. Went through 2 very expensive pumping wet vacs before this. Love it. PS, just in case I Never leave it alone.
customer_reviews.author: Caru

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give 100 stars if I could!!! Helped drain our yard's flooding issues we had 2-3 ft of water at it's highest! Took about 3-4 days pumping 8-12 hours to get it all out.
customer_reviews.author: DaddyJust

customer_reviews.title: Buy this pump
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump to help with my yearly backyard flooding from snow melt and rain running down the hill into our backyard and it does the job with no issues. Attach a hose, plug it in, and let it work. We pump thru 100’ of hose and the stream of water is constant and at a high rate. No issues with clogging even with our yard full of leaves and other debris. My basement is dry and my pond is gone. I have nothing negative to say about this product.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Pump
customer_reviews.text: My mistake I thought it was auto start and stop, it’s not you have to plug it in to start then monitor it until it finishes removing water and then unplug it so it the pump doesn’t run dry and burn out. This pump is heavy duty and does a great job of removing water fast, so I am not sending it back, but I did have to order another one that is automatic. Read all the specifications throughly before ordering any pump to ensure it’s the right one for your needs. All in All this is a great pump.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, using to pump low spots in the yard until dirt work and yard can be fixed. Easy to clean to remove trash sucked into impeller. Requires a small Philips screw driver and a ice pic to clean
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good for removing standing water from yard
customer_reviews.text: This pump might be OK for getting water out of a basemment or other hard surfaced and very clean area. No good for getting standing water out of yard. Clogs easily and stops frequently. Too little power to overcome friction through long garden hose. Get a stronger pump for removal of water from low ground. Amazon was very good about accepting return. I reported problem and chipped back within a few days and was fully credited.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bell

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Not For Use With Pools or Spas
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pump the water out of my spa. It short-circuited on the first use and dumped oil all over the interior of the spa. I called the Wayne Customer Service line and they said look at page six of the instructions, which says "This product not approved for swimming pool applications or as a pool or spa cover pump." They said they could replace it, but if they did I was NOT to use it in a spa or pool.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bee

customer_reviews.title: Way too slow
customer_reviews.text: For a pump of this size and power the volume of water it pulls is way too low and it pumps way too slowly to be of any real value. It's good for helping a "real" pump or if you have nothing else but it's not going to ever be your "go to" tool in an emergency. It simply doesn't move enough water fast enough. I have smaller, cheaper pumps that can give a garden hose a run for their money. This thing is hardly more than a slow steady stream and when you want to move water, that's just not good enough. Extremely disappointed, especially considering the massive size of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bazzinotti

customer_reviews.title: Poor investment
customer_reviews.text: Had it for 6 weeks to drain a low area on the yard. Was diligent in insuring pump was not running without water in the area. Just stopped working. Cleaned as instructed and started up for again for about 10 seconds and then died. Pump engine is blown. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Charron

customer_reviews.title: Great to drain a low spot
customer_reviews.text: I use this pump to drain a low section of my yard that collects water from melted snow and spring rains. I've connected 100 feet of hose to the pump and I am able to drain my wet area almost completely. I keep the pump in a bucket with holes drilled all around it so that water comes in and the pump isn't sitting directly on mud. There have been no issues sucking up dirt and getting plugged up but I do clean it after using - very easy to clean. This has been one of my most useful purchases for an "outdoor" tool!
customer_reviews.author: DTBriz

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but a nice little submersible pump that does its job very effectively
customer_reviews.text: We didn't cover the pool and it was horrific trying to open it... the pool pump got clogged with leaves while draining it, and burned out. Within 1 day, we had about 4 feet of scummy water drained and were able to get in and give it a good scrub. It could also multitask and come in handy if the basement floods since it's submersible so good to have around.
customer_reviews.author: MissWright

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump for pumping the water from a creek to my vegetable garden. The distance is a little over 100 yards, and the height is about 20+ yards. It works OK. Water comes out in the garden , but not very strong. It takes me a long time to water all my vegetables. But still better than some of the 1 HP pumps on the market. I tried many pumps, can't find a good pump for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Nermal

customer_reviews.title: It's NOT automatic!
customer_reviews.text: pumps down to last drop, BUT, please note you must plug/unplug from outlet to turn on/off! THe description was vaguely deceptive, there is NO float or water sensor (i assumed water sensor, myself) on this unit. At first thought it was a malfunction, until I drilled-down on mfgs website description. I also believe cord to be short, and lighter duty than expected. Other than that, I'm sure it's a competent pump. If the manual operation is not an issue, go ahead and buy this cute little pump.
customer_reviews.author: ba-da-bing!

customer_reviews.title: Does what it promised
customer_reviews.text: I get pretty consistant water along one wall of the basement. It is never more than 1/4 inch deep anywhere. I put this pump in the lowest spot, use a deck broom to push the water to it and it does the job! Very fast and powerful. Has been in use for 6 months pretty regularly. It stopped working recnetly. I read the manual and cleaned the screen, put it back together and now its working again. Love this little guy!
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: I have a basement now prone to seepage after big storms. Take #2 - 2/2018.
customer_reviews.text: Am posting an amended review. Had bought another brand pump at Home Depot but it needed more water depth to properly work. Did my research and this works in less water. American-made. Not so noisy and it worked fine for about 40 intermitant hours spread over 7 or 8 months. Had flooding due to a weather warm-up in 2/2018 with 3 inches of rain which had nowhere to go - frozen ground here in Illinois. The unit worked about 8 hours one day, four the next and stopped working. Never has worked again....
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bruchas

customer_reviews.title: A great lil pump
customer_reviews.text: As sump pumps go, this one isn’t cheap, but, it works. I’m using it on a home built solar system used to heat an above ground inflatable pool, about 5,000 gallons. It runs water from the pool through PVC coils mounted on top of a garage which is about 50 feet from the pool and about 17 feet higher than the bottom of the pool. I had tried 1/2 hp pumps which wouldn’t do the job, but, this one works flawlessly, besides, it’s kind of cute.
customer_reviews.author: AkRascal

customer_reviews.title: The little pump that could!
customer_reviews.text: After record-breaking May rains that caused basement flooding, I bought this pump on the recommendation of some neighbors. I used it in 1/2" of water, as well as in a sump pit when the pump crapped out, and it worked like a champ! It was very easy to use (less back-breaking than the shop-vac). It does not have an automatic shutoff, so you have to keep an eye on it. This was well worth the money and has many potential uses, though I hope to not have to use it again for a flooded basement. :(
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Mom

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump to remove rainwater from my flat roof which developed a leak somewhere. Even with some leaves, redwood needles and other debris, this pump is a miracle. It is very powerful and really does practically leave the surface dry. At first I tried to run it on top of the plastic I had laid out on the roof, but the suction was too powerful. I found that putting the pump in the flooded area on top of a thin, rigid material kept it from pulling in the tarp. The only way this product could be better is if it had and auto on/off, but it does the job fabulously!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer ww

customer_reviews.title: Bought for single-use flooded dirt-floor basement
customer_reviews.text: I helped my neighbor when their dirt floor basement was under several inches of very dodgy water. This little WaterBug worked like a charm in a stressful situation. Attached a garden hose to the top, plugged it in, and it immediately went to work. As this was purchased for a single use event, and the water was very, very dirty, I have no desire to try to clean the item to use again. At no point did the WaterBug jam or slow down. Hopefully, I'll never have a need for one of these again, but if I do, I would absolutely purchase a Wayne WaterBug again.
customer_reviews.author: Ritch

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT work for pools
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pump to drain water that accumulates on my pool cover over the winter. Unfortunately, unless the water is totally clean, the pump intake will very quickly clog with any dirt, leaves or other gunk that accumulates on the pool cover. I tried isolating the pump in a bucket with holes cut into it to allow water in, but it still clogged in only a minute. Wayne makes a more expensive pump that does work well with standing pool water; I'd go with that for pools covers.
customer_reviews.author: A. G. Biggs

customer_reviews.title: If your basement floods a little, this is for you!
customer_reviews.text: The waterbug is amazing! We have a finished basement that suddenly started flooding, like a few inches through the house flooding. The waterbug is so quiet and is a little beast. We have two and feed them to a (also a Wayne brand) submersible.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Does not shut off when dry.
customer_reviews.text: Before I wrote this review, I wanted to give the company a chance to make it right. but their phone is not working. The thing will not shut off even when the pool cover is bone-dry. It also gets stopped up with debris which it is not supposed to do. Bad deal, lot of trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Ken McArthur

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for amateurs
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed by this little guy. He plugs into a normal extension cord and connects normally to a garden hose. No priming, just plug and pump. So far, he's very tolerant of getting partially plugged by mud or continuing to run for an hour or so after the water becomes too low. Solidly built but not heavy to lift. Nice compact size. I don't usually personify products, but he's kind of cute with the yellow color and stubby shape.
customer_reviews.author: RaDadIndy

customer_reviews.title: Pump stopped working after 7 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this pump on November 9, 2018. I used it as a pool cover pump to pump rain water from my pool cover. Yesterday I realized that it was not working. After close inspection, I saw oil mixed with water. Looks like pumped leaked oil and stopped working. When I tried to unplug the power cable and plug it back in, it trips the GFI outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Mehmet C.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I needed an easy-to-use and good suction power to remove excess water from winterized pool. I dropped this unit into an old plastic 5-gal bucket (drilled 1" holes all over it) and lowered it into in-ground pool and seems to remove about 2" of water/hour off of pool (I needed to remove about 10" of water, so took about 5 hours). It's very quiet and does the job I wanted it to do.
customer_reviews.author: kasga2012

customer_reviews.title: Used for pool cover and roof.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to use an automatic pool cover pump but was not satisfied about the water level to make the pump work. So I lost the auto feature with this pump but gained a lower water level to make the pump work. This pump is fantastic. Fast. Works at a very low water level and self primes. Easy to use. Tough built. Would highly recommend. I might even take this in my rv when I camp to fill water tanks from river. ( no I will not drink the water from said river ).
customer_reviews.author: Kells.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful yet lightweight
customer_reviews.text: We are in a huge drought here and having grown up in the seventies during the Great Everything shortage we are pumping our shower water out on to our lawn so we have at least one small green patch. This pump is light weight but powerfull. It gets all the water out of the tub without a problem of any sort. Would highly recommend for any submersible pump usage.
customer_reviews.author: S.G.

customer_reviews.title: Tough as Nails! Silent!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to redo my pool. I tried my best but could not kill it! Drained 10,000 gallon pool in about 18 hours and I was running it from the deep end 8 feet down and pumping the water about 100 feet in a hose. Tough!
customer_reviews.author: SirCoolahan

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I had two weeks of flash floods and this saved me!!! It looks like yellow plastic in the photo but it is a heavy iron type contraption and works like a work horse. My sump pump die, my back up sump pump die, I rented a sump pump thing to empty the basement the first week which was a daily expense and the fireman's type hose kept collapsing. I had several feet in my basement and 10 standing inches in the backyard. I plugged this in attached a yard hose, lowered it into the basement and water emptied. The next morning put in in the yard and all the water emptied. This should be a Christmas gift for everyone!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the pump as a Christmas present and did not inspect it before wrapping it. We open presents on the 30th because of a death in the family. Much to my surprise an ear was broken on the pump. We choose not to return it because the ear was only used to hold the power cord when not in use. I have learned a lesson and will inspect closely all orders in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Strong pump and no priming needed.
customer_reviews.text: This pump is fantastic. We are in the middle of a swimming pool build and I’m using it to pump water out of the pool when it rains. The manufacturer claims it pumps down to 1/8 inch but I’m not so sure. It makes a gurgling noise when the water level get down to 1/4 inch and I don’t want to burn out the pump so that’s where I call it quits. The way I like to review a product is to answer the question, “Would I recommend this product and/or buy again?” Yes, absolutely
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unbox, Plug-N-Pump
customer_reviews.text: This thing went straight from the box to the water, using the quick setup instructions. Flows so much that it was washing my gravel drive out in a small pocket. Minor thing, you need to make sure your fitting are tight, may want to remove the fittings and add teflon tap, common use on water fittings. excellent tool for draining the water off the top of our above ground pool cover..
customer_reviews.author: J&M

customer_reviews.title: Reliable emergency tool that everyone should have.
customer_reviews.text: After $40k in damage in our finished basement I purchased the water bug to use in case of a future emergency. No more flooding but our pool cover had several hundred gallons of water on top and was creating a strain that looked like the cover might tear. Grabbed the waterbug attached a hose and plugged the in the unit. I didn’t walk on the pool cover but tossed the unit into the water and in a few tries I had the unit placed in the middle of water and debris and watched as it began removing the water. I was very impressed and would highly recommend as a tool for everyone just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Easy schmeezy
customer_reviews.text: Pump is nicely designed with cord management. I like the 10'coord which gets the connection to an extension cord far away from the water action. I'll never use the side port but nice to now it's there. This pump lowers my 15x30' pool when it fills up from rain about one inch in 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: MrVideo

customer_reviews.title: Thankfully I haven't had to use it in an emergency ...
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully I haven't had to use it in an emergency, but I did test it when it came in a big tub of water. I hooked up the side discharge and ran the garden hose over an 8 foot board propped upright in our garage door. The water came shooting out the other end. I'm confident this will do the job when the next "500 year" flood comes. We've had three in the last 30 years.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what is promises! Saved my basement:)
customer_reviews.text: My hot water tank died! =flooded basement! I am not rich, this pump took about 3 inches of water out of my basement. I was able to mop the surface and dry with fan. Easy to use, don’t let it run on a dry surface, follow instructions and it does what is says. Saved me! Also, always be mindful of your power cord if using extension cord. I used 50 foot cord and 75 foot hose, goodbye unwanted water. Does not have off/on switch-you must unplug. Don’t leave unattended. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to setup and use and this little pump is really getting it done!! Nearly silent and so tough and durable. Just ensure to pull it up and clean the bottom suction surface off every now and then. Drained a small pond in the backyard in about 7 hours without any issues whatsoever. Highly recommend for the ease of use, it’s reliability, and it’s affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Ben L.

customer_reviews.title: Totally Sucks!❤️ In a good way
customer_reviews.text: My pool flooded so i bought this. Sucked the water to the street so fast. I had to get rid of 3 inches in a 10 thousand gallon pool. It said don’t add an extension cord but the cord that came with it was short like 10 ft. I added the extension cord and there was no problems. No heat on the lines etc. Awesome product did what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: good pump for the price
customer_reviews.text: First the good stuff, I like the feet as it gives the pump good balance [ I use to pump water off my pool cover]. It is very easy to use and resists clogging with leaves. i was a bit annoyed that i had to go to Home Depot to buy the $3.50 adapter to use a 2 inch hose line, it should have come included. At first i was disappointed to the water pressure on discharge but i have learned to accept that it pumps the water off the pool even if i was anticipating more suction. Good pump for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: William D Wright

customer_reviews.title: I couldn’t wait to show you!
customer_reviews.text: We were desperately waiting for this pump to arrive so we could remove water from our kiddie pool. It arrived yesterday and immediately I took it back to see what it can do. VERY HAPPY with the performance. Within 25 minute this thing has emptied the 8ft x 4ft x 2.5ft sized pool filled with water. See the before and after image in my review.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: This unit works as advertized
customer_reviews.text: Let me preface this by saying I only review an item if I am really happy with it or hate it. This time extremely happy! I have only used it once but - it works great - it is quiet I mean really quiet, output is good and it really gets the water down to almost nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Weester

customer_reviews.title: Great little pump
customer_reviews.text: This pump is great! I used it to pump out my Hot Tub, which used to take hours to drain. This pump does it in short order. pumped my tub Dow to less than a quarter of an inch. Very well made. The only reason for 4 stars instead of five is that it does not automatically shut off. You have to watch it or you will damage the pump.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the Promises
customer_reviews.text: Don't throw away your wet-vac yet. This does not pump out water when it's not a LOT of water. It tries to suck at it, but less than one inch of water doesn't have much hope. I won't be needing it. My lanai get wet every time it rains and the wet vac is the only answer. (it's big and clumsy so I had high hopes.)
customer_reviews.author: BeeJay

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks.  And this time that’s good.
customer_reviews.text: What a lifesaver. I don’t have a sink or a drain in my basement so I was carrying the stupid shop vac up the stairs when we got water. Now I plug this in and run the hose into the yard and in 5 mins it’s done. Note: once it sucks up the water you have to let it run a few minutes more so it passes the remainder of the water in the pump through the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: The only submersible pump that you will need.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pump and I have used two other brands that failed. This one is simple, pumped all the water off of my pool cover and worked flawlessly. Well made product and would recommend to others that need a product and solution that works. I expect many years of carefree use.
customer_reviews.author: ezflyer13

customer_reviews.title: Drained my inground pool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to drain my inground pool. I bought this model because it drains almost all the water. It drained my pool down to like an inch or less in the deep end. It also hooks up to a water hose. This pump would work well in a flooded patch of yard or a flooded basement. This is not the fastest pump but it is very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.... for the first 30 minutes....
customer_reviews.text: Was super excited about this product. Started to pump, and it’s not super fast, but it worked well. That is until it didn’t. Too expensive to only work 1/2 a job or one job. Will be returning and getting something that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: DDT

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: Saved us during a time that our sump pump went out during heavy rains. This is a very powerful tool at draining water. This device circumvented water from entering the house when our walkout patio was full to the rim with water due to our sump pump failing. The item is lightweight and easy to operate!
customer_reviews.author: Bridgeh20

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Cracked and Broken - Otherwise, had potential.
customer_reviews.text: The pump arrived broken and the plastic as cracked around the top output. Thus, while the pump sucked a water fountain was created at the top from the cracked housing (even though the cap was tight). It still sucked and shot out water from the side output value so the power would have been pretty good had it not arrived broken. I choose a replacement instead of a return in hopes that if one arrives that is not broken this pump will live up to the positive reviews. Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Looks Cool and Works really well
customer_reviews.text: Like most everything now I have one that was not damaged in shipping. It looks and works great. Only design improvement would be to add a carrying /moving handle in the design. Temptation is to move it around via electrical cord. Having said that i would for sure buy i again. Works "Great and super quiet"!! It's yellow which is right on and brings it to life!!
customer_reviews.author: NigelJ

customer_reviews.title: Best general-purpose utility pump I've found
customer_reviews.text: These, the Wayne Water Bug, are great. I owned one for several years, needed a second pump, and bought another of these without hesitation. It's rugged, need not be primed, will start in 3/16" of water, and will pump down to 1/16". It needs some cleaning after pumping water with debris (remove grate with screwdriver), but paint chips, dirt, hair, etc. from basement floor swept in with water did not seem to damage it, just slow it down. There's seemingly nothing like it on Amazon or in the big-box home improvement stores.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great pump
customer_reviews.text: We live in Alaska and every year get a buildup of ice that can't be removed by the snowplow. When it starts melting, or when we get early rains, the water backs up toward my outbuilding. This pump is perfect for getting water away from the building and down the driveway. I'll probably buy another just to have an extra on hand. This is definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: 1BigBear

customer_reviews.title: It's really a submersable only
customer_reviews.text: I would be better if it can handle being run dry, clogged, or with intermittent water. The 1/16" is a nice spec but its not really practical if you are trying to dry smooth surfaces without babysitting the pump. No internal sensors or controls except for a thermal cut off.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Highly effective product.
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this product. I Used it to drain my koi pond. You simply connect a hose to one of the two openings, plug it in and aim your hose in the direction you wish the water to flow- that’s it. I also use it to move standing water after a rain. I’ll be using this product regularly for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: L.j

customer_reviews.title: Best sump pump I ever bought... powerful enough to send pool water to roof solar collectors
customer_reviews.text: This is the best, most powerful, most reliable sump pump I've ever bought. This pump sends a very solid stream of water from my in ground pool up to my roof top solar collectors when the pool is not being used. It's probably the sixth pump I've tried over the years and it's the only pump I would buy again... in an instant.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but gets clogged
customer_reviews.text: Powerful but gets clogged. Gets the water off our pool top cover but debris clogs the intake and so pump loses power. Debris must be cleaned periodically. Some form of prefilter technology at the intake would help. Nevertheless, I am still quite satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: MMI

customer_reviews.title: Works great for high volume
customer_reviews.text: I used this to drain my pool, worked like a charm after 3 hours. It doesn't turn off automatically so you have to tend it. It drains down to about 3/4 inches. I use it as needed, but I don't leave it out as a pool cover pump. It's great in a pinch. I had a plumbing misadventure and kept it by leak until I could call in the plumbing calvary the next day- worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus T. Higi

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Quiet, hardworking little pump! I couldn't tell whether it has started yet because it made no noise at all, but by looking at the flood water retreating, I knew it was working quietly. This is the third year I am using the pump to drain the rain water accumulated in thn front porch. This morning rained hard and the little pump worked all morning and into early afternoon, drained a pool of water otherwise would have taken days to clear.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Chen Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, hassle free...
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to drain my Jacuzzi. For years, since 2003, I have been paying good money, up to $110 recently, to have my Jacuzzi cleaned by a local hot tub retail Co. I decided to spend that hundred dollars on the Wayne WaterBUG to clean it myself. Wonderful product and very efficient. So much so that I bought one for my nephew in Michigan who has a small pool for his three little girls and was looking for something to drain it easily. Good money spent.
customer_reviews.author: D. Reyna

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: We have a concrete floor in our crawl space and while building the house, it would rain and water would stand in puddles in the crawl space. I needed an easy way to remove the water and this little gem was the answer. It works great and gets almost every bit of water. It has saved me lots of time and effort when removing the water.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda L Blackmon

customer_reviews.title: This is a MUST for Pool Owners
customer_reviews.text: We had a marathon winter in Michigan. It started with a very wet fall, a snowy winter, then a wet early spring. I drained the cover on my pool with this pump about 6 times. Each time it worked incredibly. I am so pleased. This was one of the tasks I dreaded most about opening my pool - now it's a breeze! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: RevRDM

customer_reviews.title: Best pump in the market
customer_reviews.text: It's the best pump in the market. Had many others and none compare. Having drain hose come out the side is huge as many others go from the top. Even if used on top base of unit makes it so the unit does not fall which happened all the time with the others. I use it for my pool cover and it sucks the water dry even being on a pitch. Great price as well. I would recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Katie & Dino

customer_reviews.title: This think sucks and that is a very good thing!
customer_reviews.text: All kidding aside, this thing takes you down to almost dry...incredible. I use it to pump out an area on my patio that likes to flood in heavy rain. Only negative is that you cannot run it dry and there is no auto cutoff.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Patrick O'leary

customer_reviews.title: Good pump
customer_reviews.text: I use it to pump the rainwater off the cover of my above ground pool. With all the rain this year it has been a blessing. For just a few pennies more that the cheap one that this is replacing I got this rugged powerful pump. Should have done this to begin with. It pumps three times faster and is less susceptible to small particulate matter.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Power water pump.
customer_reviews.text: My basement flooded with about three inches of water. This little pump sucked the entire basement down to the bare floor within minutes. It did what it says it will do. It even sucked up some small debris that was floating in the water with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: David62

customer_reviews.title: Great pump!!
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome!!! The reviews with pictures of nasty pools it really does take all the nasty out but you have to clean all the debris leaves, helicopters etc. out or it will probably clog your hose. If you are looking for a good pump this is the one!! I hope it lasts a long time!!
customer_reviews.author: Kora

customer_reviews.title: Not for pools or hot tubs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump to quickly drain our hot tub. What I learned after the fact, is that it is not intended to be used for pools or hot tubs. They say the chemicals will damage the seals. I had already purchased it and used it for this purpose before I learned this information. So it's too late for me, but it's not too late for you.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Pool Pump
customer_reviews.text: I used this to drain my pool for painting the pool and it worked very well and did all it said it would do.
customer_reviews.author: John Carver

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Only used once but it performed great. Drained a hot tub to a sink 20 feet above. Took about an hour so it worked fast. Had no problem sucking up light sediment and algae. Will come back and update my review if there are any longevity issues.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: It's very quick to disburse standing water, and I ...
customer_reviews.text: It's very quick to disburse standing water, and I wish I would've read the product description more closely. Only downfall is that it's not an automatic shutoff once the water level falls below a threshold level.
customer_reviews.author: J.Rocha

customer_reviews.title: A good Pump
customer_reviews.text: It was not easy to work with this pump. Its 120v while in Oman we have 220v. The company does not recommend using any adapters or converters although according to their specifications they talked only about Adapters NOT Converters. Finally I decided to purchase a 2000 watt converter and found that everything is OK. The Pump is working properly. Here is my video showing the pump and the converter!
customer_reviews.author: abuburair

customer_reviews.title: Arrived defective but repairable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and noticed the top threaded output was cracked on both sides. This was prior to me setting the brass piece is CD ame with. I used some blue lock tight and threaded the insert in. No leaks and the crack did not get worse.
customer_reviews.author: T.Lekas

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the suggested sump hose and check valve offered by Amazon as frequently bought together. They do not fit together
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't really push water as efficiently as advertised. And it costs more to send the son-of-a-gun back than it is worth
customer_reviews.author: Semaj

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little pump
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little pump. A real work horse. This is my second one, the first worked wonderfully, but after an extended use simply stopped (almost like the switch was turned off). I contacted Amazon who immediately replaced it in record time. I am impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Hedgpath

customer_reviews.title: Amazing - but be careful when you have to clean it
customer_reviews.text: This little guy works amazingly well - it'll suck up water to just about bare earth! However, if it gets clogged - actually before it does - make sure you read the instructions on what screws to take out and which ones NOT to! I made the mistake of taking one out that wasn't supposed to be and it stripped the threads when I tried to put it back in. Unit still worked fine though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until
customer_reviews.text: Great little pump, easy to use and did not clog at all. Used to pump extra water from my lawn that the landlord really needs to French drain instead. However after three months of running for only max three days a week the motor gave out😔
customer_reviews.author: EmmyV

customer_reviews.title: If I use this, anybody can!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, so simple! Plug in a hose for water out, turn off electricity to spa, drop the WaterBUG into the deepest section of the hot tub, place hose end where you want the water to drain, plug the WaterBUG into a safe electrical outlet! 600 gallon tub emptied so fast, I couldn't believe it! It was quiet too.... you have to be there when it empties so it doesn't suck air, but this item has removed any dread associated with my hot tub draining days, I now look forward to the next time!! :) Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya P.

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I cannot tell you how easy this pump is to use because it was defective when it arrived. I bought it to take water out of a pond that was on the verge of flooding from several days of rain. Followed the instructions to the letter but the pump just sat there like a stone at the bottom of my pond. I might as well have tried to suck the water out with a straw, it would have been cheaper and accomplished more. At least Amazon made it easy to return.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good little pump, used for flooded basement. A little slow but good for the price. Very easy to use too.
customer_reviews.author: JenJen

customer_reviews.title: It plugs up with any debris and stops pumping!
customer_reviews.text: I got this pump to remove the water from our pool cover. I thought the design was great With a wide base and ribbed edges to keep debris out of the pickup area. However after using it i find that it takes only a small amount of leaf debris to plug it up completely and then it becomes useless! The little giant I used before I bought this pump was far better!
customer_reviews.author: John Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use just in case you get too much water.
customer_reviews.text: Starts in shallow water and pumps til nearly dry. Easy to use and store. I recommend 2 - 100 foot hoses and 2 waterbug pumps to keep up with a hard rain. You can buy a less expensive pump with more gallons per minute but it takes deeper water to prime and will not pump so shallow without over heating. This clever design won't tip over very easy. Joe S
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: Great little all-around utility pump
customer_reviews.text: We used this to pump water off of a solar pool cover and to empty our 14 ft above-ground pool. Attached the hose, drop it in, and plug it in. Wish it would cut off automatically when there is no more water going through it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Maynard

customer_reviews.title: A giant of a small submersible pump that works very well.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little submersible pump. I use it to drain a 1200 gallon swim spa and it works very well. It takes about two hours and gets all but about an eight of an inch out of the bottom. I'm amazed that a pump this small and inexpensive does so well.
customer_reviews.author: T J Moffett

customer_reviews.title: very quiet
customer_reviews.text: quality product. Nice and quiet and I like the option to have the hose on the top and side connection, garden hose fitting is very convient and it can suck the water down to about 1/8 inch. Perfect for basement clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I put this on a pool cover filled with about 2 feet of water and within about 5 hours the water was gone off the cover. This is on a 16x34 pool. Couldn't believe the volume of water coming out of the hose end. I was really impressed. Wouldn't hesitate to buy it again when it is time to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Saved my back and has given me peace of mind for future storms
customer_reviews.text: The basement drain at my parent’s house was clogged and we got a heavy late winter rain. The ground was so saturated that we got 3” of water in the basement. After breaking our backs after the first time this happened, I ordered the Waterbug. This little beast made short work of the cleanup. I added a sensor that will turn the pump on once the water reaches the sensor, and turns it off after the water level goes down. Only way to improve this product would be to add a built-in sensor so that it can be left plugged in and at the ready.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Use it everytime my crawl space floods. Has its limits, once water gets down to about an inch it can't pump anymore because it starts sucking air, better turn it off or you will burn the motor out
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Good Pump
customer_reviews.text: Got this when my basement flooded. The pump I had would not pick up water lower than 3/8 inch. I especially like the two exit points. Allows me to either pump into the basement drain or up and out into the alley. Built solid.
customer_reviews.author: Retired and Loving It

product_meta.title: WAYNE WWB WaterBUG Submersible Pump with Multi-Flo Technology,Yellow
product_meta.description: Top discharge is perfect for tight spaces where water removal is needed laundry tubs, window wells, buckets, bathtubs, etc. Side discharge is ideal for easy water removal from flat open surfaces: flat roofs, flooded basements, standing water in yard, shower stalls, etc. 30 ft. Max head removes water down to 1/16 in. Of surface, virtually dry! multi-ring suction strainer filters debris, and minimizes clogs
feature_bullets: The pump should be unplugged once the water is no longer being moved, or pump will run dry.
Assembled in the US with foreign and domestic parts
Multi-flo technology allows easy selection of the appropriate discharge for the application
Top discharge is perfect for tight spaces where water removal is needed; window wells, buckets, etc.
Side discharge is ideal for easy water removal from flat open surfaces: flat roofs, flooded basements, standing water in yard, shower stalls, etc
30 ft. Max head.; removes water down to 1/16 in. Of surface, virtually dry. For removing water from flooded basements, boats, stock tanks, and even a 5 gallon bucket
Max. Flow rate is 1257 gallons per hour: 900 gph at 10 ft; 3/4 in. Corrosion Resistant Brass discharge outlets, with tethered cap seals, fits any standard garden hose
Eliminate standing water in your yard, and the risk to attract mosquitos. Use the WaterBUG to stop the bugs!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,069 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
